note.p: Education: Trinity College, Dublin; Lincoln's Inn (entered 1800)

Career: Called to the Irish Bar (1802); helped found the "Quarterly Review" (1807); Secretary of the Admiralty, for defending the Duke of York in the case of Mary Anne Clarke (until 1830); edited Boswell's "Life of Johnson" (1831)
References: W P Griffith and P J T Morris, 'Charles Hatchett FRS (1765 - 1847), chemist and discoverer of niobium' in NR 2003 vol 57 pp 299 - 316
